Surgical care is often provided in partnership with anesthesiologists. Care records describe the operation, the anesthetic, staff involved, equipment used and instructions for post-operative care.
Sharing care records is difficult because their structure and content isn't consistent between different care record system providers. This Implementation Guide is an attempt to define a framework for representing the anesthetic care record. In the first phase, only the intra-operative details are in scope. In the next phase, pre- and post-operative phases will be considered.

Peri-operative care begins with surgical referral and can extend into a prolonged post-operative care period. This IG is resticted to the anesthetic care received during a surgical care episode and additionally, to the intra-operative phase of the episode.
Some parts of the anesthetic care record are covered by existing IGs. For example, data captured from bedside or near-patient monitoring devices is in the scope of the Point-of-Care Device Implementation Guide

This Implementation Guide is intended for
healthcare professionals that are involved in the design, specification, procurement and deployment of digital care records, in particular AIMS (Anesthesia Information Management Systems).
Developers and system integration engineers seeking to exchange structured care data between existing systems
Developers of new care record systems, in particular AIMS.
